SEARCH
Package com.paradegame.ai

Class AIPlayer

java.lang.Object
com.paradegame.model.Player
com.paradegame.ai.AIPlayer
Direct Known Subclasses:
EasyAI, HardAI, MediumAI
public abstract class AIPlayer extends Player
The AIPlayer class represents an computer-controlled player in the game. It extends the Player class and provides abstract methods for AI decision-making. Concrete implementations should define how the AI chooses cards and discards. This class is extended by EasyAI, MediumAI and HardAI class.

  • Method Details

    • chooseCard

      public abstract Card chooseCard(Parade parade)
      Abstract method for the AI to choose a card to play from its hand. Subclasses must implement their own logic for choosing a card to play.
      Parameters:
      parade - the current state of the Parade
      Returns:
      the chosen Card to play

    • chooseDiscards

      public abstract int[] chooseDiscards(List<Card> hand, List<Player> allPlayers)
      Abstract method for the AI to choose cards to discard from its hand. Subclasses must implement their own logic for discarding cards.
      Parameters:
      hand - the list of cards in the AI's hand
      allPlayers - the list of all players in the game
      Returns:
      an array of two integers, each representing the index of a card to discard from the hand

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the AI player.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Player
      Returns:
      a string indicating that the player is an AI player.
